Key Match Events: Reece Topley took 4 wickets, including key dismissals of Tanzid Hasan, Najmul Hossain Shanto, and Shakib Al Hasan.
England's openers delivered an over 100 run partnership.
England were restricted to a total of 364 runs.
Sam Curran took the last wicket to defeat Bangladesh by 137 runs.
Mark Wood clean bowled Shoriful Islam.
Adil Rashid took a wicket, clean bowling Towhid Hridoy.
Liam Livingstone struck first ball, getting Hridoy caught behind by Buttler.
Chris Woakes enticed an edge from Mehidy Hasan Miraz, caught by Jos Buttler.
Liton Das reached his fifty off 38 balls.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh won the toss and asked England to bat first.
England made one change in their lineup with Reece Topley replacing Moeen Ali.
Post-Match Reflections: Dawid Malan reflected on his innings, mentioning the pitch conditions and the importance of the partnership with Jonny Bairstow.
England will feel better after today's match as they are heading towards a big victory over Bangladesh and improve their net run rate.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh bowled and fielded exceptionally well in the last 10 overs, conceding just 66 runs while taking 6 wickets.
England missed out on the opportunity to score over 400 runs in a World Cup match for the first time.
